greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of eta(q^3)^2 * eta(q^4) * eta(q^6)^2 * eta(q^36) / (eta(q) * eta(q^9) * eta(q^12)^2) in powers of q.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: a(n) is multiplicative with a(2^e) = 1, a(3^e) = 2*(-1)^(e+1) if e>0, a(p^e) = e+1 if p == 1 (mod 4), a(p^e) = (1 + (-1)^e)/2 if p == 3 (mod 4).
mathematica: eta[x_] := x^(1/24)*QPochhammer[x]; A122864[n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ (eta[q^3]^2*eta[q^4]*eta[q^6]^2*eta[q^36])/(eta[q]*eta[q^9]*eta[q^12]^2), {q, 0, n}]; Table[A122864[n], {n, 50}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 16 2017 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<1, 0, n--; A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x^3 + A)^2 * eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^6 + A)^2 * eta(x^36 + A) /(eta(x + A) * eta(x^9 + A) * eta(x^12 + A)^2), n))}
(PARI) {a(n) = local(A, p, e); if( n<1, 0, A = factor(n); prod( k=1, matsize(A)[1], if( p=A[k, 1], e=A[k, 2]; if( p==2, 1, if( p==3, -2*(-1)^e, if( p%4==1, e+1, 1-e%2))))))}
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Sep 15 2006
